docs.snippet: "An Inconvenient Truth" wins two Oscars, and the former vice president wins a huge ovation....
docs.lead_paragraph: For those of you tuning in the to Academy Awards tonight to see if Al Gore would, 1) win an Oscar for his documentary, "An Inconvenient Truth," and 2) use the platform of the awards ceremony to announce he was running for president -- well yes, the documentary won an Oscar.
docs.abstract: "An Inconvenient Truth" wins two Oscars, and the former vice president wins a huge ovation.

headline.main: Gore Wins Hollywood in a Landslide

docs.snippet: In the foreign film category, there was one winner, but no losers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Lot's of Spanish is being spoken tonight by the winners in the press room. "Pan's Labyrinth" won the makeup, cinematography and art direction awards, but the ultimate prize -- best foreign film -- eluded the dark fairytale look at Spanish fascism. Instead, "The Lives of Others," a film about East Germany's history of spying and the havoc it wreaked on those who spied, as well as those who were spyed upon.
docs.abstract: In the foreign film category, there was one winner, but no losers.

headline.main: Oscar Is Speaking a Lot of Spanish and a Little German

docs.snippet: Wending through the crowd on the carpet....
docs.lead_paragraph: There is a kind of striving out on carpet that leaves the Bagger confused and not knowing where to look. Al Gore or Maggie Gyllenhaal, Nicole Simpson or Guillermo del Toro?
docs.abstract: Wending through the crowd on the carpet.

docs.snippet: Finally, an end to red carpets and the show begins....
docs.lead_paragraph: Life on the Oscar carpet was fast and furious. The Bagger managed to mistake Rachel Weisz, star of the "The Fountain" and "The Constant Gardiner," for Emily Blount, star of "The Devil Wears Prada."
docs.abstract: Finally, an end to red carpets and the show begins.

headline.main: A Last Evening on the Carpet

docs.snippet: Today's workout lasted about two hours – about an hour shorter than normal – perhaps as a reprieve for players having to report by 7:30 a.m. for photos. So, aside from a few questions, the post-workout press conference with Willie Randolph dea...
docs.lead_paragraph: Today's workout lasted about two hours - about an hour shorter than normal - perhaps as a reprieve for players having to report by 7:30 a.m. for photos. So, aside from a few questions, the post-workout press conference with Willie Randolph dealt with such pressing topics as his Oscar picks ("The Departed"), music and - and I have no idea how the conversation evolved to this point; it may have been Jerry Manuel praising his old 1963 Chevy Impala - the gangsta lean.
docs.abstract: Today's workout lasted about two hours – about an hour shorter than normal – perhaps as a reprieve for players having to report by 7:30 a.m. for photos. So, aside from a few questions, the post-workout press conference with Willie Randolph dealt with such pressing topics as his Oscar picks ("The Departed"), music and – [...]

docs.snippet: The Bagger gets ready, and begs his readers for a little help....
docs.lead_paragraph: How exciting, people say, you'll be on the red carpet for the Oscars.
docs.abstract: The Bagger gets ready, and begs his readers for a little help.

docs.snippet: A really inconvenient truth: The rest of the world doesn't care about Oscar....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sasha Stone, the den mother of Oscar bloggers, suggests in an interview with E! that the rest of the world may not care what happens tonight. The Bagger read the whole thing with his eyes closed.
docs.abstract: A really inconvenient truth: The rest of the world doesn't care about Oscar.

docs.snippet: Done with playing the hormonal mom, Robin Wright Penn breaks her independent streak. Lynn Hirschberg tunes in....
docs.lead_paragraph: Done with playing the hormonal mom, Robin Wright Penn breaks her independent streak. Lynn Hirschberg tunes in.

docs.snippet: HEARTS cease to race. Engagements are broken. Marriages end. And when they do, it is not unusual for otherwise rational adults to behave like jilted teenagers, willing to do whatever it takes -- make long detours, flee a club -- to avoid running i...
docs.lead_paragraph: HEARTS cease to race. Engagements are broken. Marriages end. And when they do, it is not unusual for otherwise rational adults to behave like jilted teenagers, willing to do whatever it takes -- make long detours, flee a club -- to avoid running into their object of affection-turned-affliction. You can bet your Oscar pool, though, that none of the celebrities attending the Academy Awards tonight will be ducking behind a massive gold statue or sprinting down the red carpet to evade a former flame.
docs.abstract: Publicists of movie stars attending Oscar presentations see to it that their clients do not have any awkward meetings with former spouses and lovers; this can involve level of orchestration that is itself worthy of Oscar nod; photos (M)

headline.main: Oscar's Big Production Number: Keeping Ex-Lovers Apart

docs.snippet: New York     Betty Halbreich     The ''original'' personal shopper, this straight-talking 79-year-old runs her own show at Bergdorf Goodman known as the Solutions department. Mantra ''I'm extremely objective.'' Speciality Working staples; ladies-w...
docs.lead_paragraph: New York Betty Halbreich The ''original'' personal shopper, this straight-talking 79-year-old runs her own show at Bergdorf Goodman known as the Solutions department. Mantra ''I'm extremely objective.'' Speciality Working staples; ladies-who-lunch clothes; high-profile evening wear. Real Clients Everyone from gala-bound dowagers to Broadway-bound stars. Dream Client Thelma Golden. Favorite Designers Robert Rodriguez, Nancy Gonzalez, Oscar de la Renta, YSL, Tuleh, Marni, Comme des Garçons. Expect to Blow Whatever your budget allows. Call (212) 872-8772.

headline.main: The Get; Shop Ahoy! V.I.P. Dressers
